channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Fouad Ajami, Commentator and Expert in Arab History, Dies at 68
item.description: Mr. Ajami, an academic and commentator on Middle East affairs, strove to put Arab history into a larger perspective and often said terrorism was one result of Muslim rage over losing power to the West in the 17th century.
item.dc:creator: By DOUGLAS MARTIN

item.title: Diplomatic Note Promises Immunity From Iraqi Law for U.S. Advisory Troops
item.description: The immunity, granted in a diplomatic note from the Iraqi government, is similar to a guarantee rejected by the Obama administration in 2011.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER

item.title: Israel Strikes Syria After Youth Is Killed
item.description: The Israeli military said it had targeted nine Syrian Army positions, including a headquarters and launching areas. The extent of any damage or casualties was not clear.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Israeli soldiers in the Golan Heights after an Israeli teenager was killed by fire from Syria.

item.title: Targeting Anwar al-Awlaki Was Legal, Justice Department Said
item.description: The Justice Department memo concluded that it would be lawful to target Anwar al-Awlaki for killing if his capture was not feasible.
item.dc:creator: By CHARLIE SAVAGE

item.title: A Win for Latin America’s Middle Class
item.description: The arrival in Brazil of more than 200,000 fans from Latin America exemplifies one of the region’s most profound shifts: the rise of the middle class.
item.dc:creator: By SIMON ROMERO
item.media:credit: Lalo de Almeida for The New York Times
item.media:description: Colombian soccer fans watched the Colombia vs. Ivory Coast match in São Paulo, Brazil.

item.title: Open Source: Anger and Dismay Online as Egypt Sentences Journalists
item.description: Rights activists, bloggers and journalists in Egypt responded with dismay to a court in Cairo sentencing three reporters to long prison terms for reporting on the unrest in the country last year.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: Claim of Fraud In Afghan Vote Leads Official To Step Down
item.description: The official stepped down a day after the candidate Abdullah Abdullah leaked tapes said to portray the official discussing ways to rig the presidential election.
item.dc:creator: By AZAM AHMED
item.media:credit: Diego Ibarra Sanchez for The New York Times
item.media:description: Ziaulhaq Amarkhil, the top election official, resigned on Monday over accusations that he was colluding with a presidential candidate Ashraf Ghani.

item.title: Pakistani Preacher Engages Government in Theatrical Battle
item.description: Thousands in Islamabad awaited the return of Muhammad Tahir-ul Qadri on Monday, ready to reignite a protest movement, but the Pakistani authorities diverted his plane.
item.dc:creator: By SALMAN MASOOD

item.title: Pro-Russian Rebels in Ukraine Match Government Cease-Fire
item.description: The leader of the self-declared Donetsk People’s Republic said the rebels in eastern Ukraine would match the government’s commitment.
item.dc:creator: By ANDREW ROTH
item.media:description: A girl embraces her boyfriend, a volunteer recruit of the Ukrainian Army, after a military ceremony in Kiev on Monday.

item.title: Last of Syria’s Declared Chemical Arms Shipped Abroad
item.description: The final portion of the more than 1,300 tons of Syria’s known chemical stockpile was loaded aboard a Danish vessel for destruction, a monitoring group said.
item.category: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Poland’s Prime Minister Says He Won’t Dismiss Officials Caught on Leaked Tapes
item.description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk said the government would focus on uncovering the “criminal gang” that made illegal recordings of ministers having blunt and profane conversations.
item.dc:creator: By RICK LYMAN

item.title: Kerry Says ISIS Threat Could Hasten Military Action
item.description: In Baghdad, Secretary of State John Kerry said the United States might not be able to wait for Iraqi politicians to form a new government before taking military action.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON
item.media:description: Hoshyar Zebari, Iraq's foreign minister, greeted Secretary of State John Kerry on Monday in Baghdad.

item.title: India Ink: Image of the Day: June 23
item.description: A widow attending an event in New Delhi to mark International Widows Day.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:description: A widow taking part in an event held by a nongovernment organization in New Delhi to mark International Widows Day. The day was commemorated by the United Nations to raise awareness to end discrimination toward widows across the world.

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Jailed Woman’s Daughter Also Accused of ‘Stirring Up Trouble’
item.description: One day after her mother was sentenced to more than six years in prison, Liao Minyue was served by the police with a demand to surrender her passport and accused of causing trouble, a lawyer said.
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: Liao Minyue received a notice ordering her to surrender her passport.

item.title: Sunni Militants Seize Crossing on Iraq-Jordan Border
item.description: The seizing of the crossing raised the specter of the insurgency’s becoming a menace not just to Iraq and Syria, but also to Jordan and Saudi Arabia.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By SUADAD AL-SALHY and TIM ARANGO

item.title: New Search Plan for Flight 370 Is Based on Farther, Controlled Flying
item.description: Investigators now believe altitude data that guided earlier searches to be unreliable and that the plane was likely not seriously damaged before its final descent.
item.dc:creator: By KEITH BRADSHER

item.title: Egyptian Court Convicts 3 Al Jazeera Journalists
item.description: Prosecutors had accused the journalists of conspiring with the Muslim Brotherhood to broadcast false reports of civil strife in order to bring down the government.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Journalists from Al Jazeera listening to the verdict on Monday, from left, Peter Greste, Mohamed Fadel Fahmy and Baher Mohamed.

item.title: Former Top Official in China to Face Graft Trial
item.description: Liu Tienan, who headed the country’s energy administration, is the latest target of President Xi Jinping’s moves against corruption.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: 32 Terrorist Groups Smashed in Xinjiang, China Says
item.description: A crackdown that began in May in the far western region of China has resulted in hundreds of terrorism suspects being sentenced, state media reported.
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG and CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: India Ink: India Promoting Lower-Cost Military Exports
item.description: A buildup of a domestic arms industry has been a goal of the country, which is a heavy importer of weapons.
item.dc:creator: By GERRY DOYLE
item.media:credit: Kuni Takahashi for The New York Times
item.media:description: Models of cruise missiles being displayed during during a defense exposition earlier this year in New Delhi, India.

item.title: Egyptian Court Convicts 3 Al Jazeera Journalists
item.description: Prosecutors had accused the journalists of conspiring with the Muslim Brotherhood to broadcast false reports of civil strife in order to bring down the government.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: The Al Jazeera journalists listening to the verdict on Monday, from left, Peter Greste, Mohamed Fadel Fahmy and Baher Mohamed.

item.title: Sentencing of Journalists in Egypt Draws Condemnation
item.description: The chorus of outrage echoed a statement by Al Jazeera English that the jailing of three of its reporters defied “any semblance of justice.”
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: Soldier Accused of Killing 5 Is Captured in South Korea
item.description: The army sergeant wounded one officer in a shootout before being captured alive with a self-inflicted gunshot wound, an official said.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: A ‘Muslim Plot’ in Birmingham Shows the Folly of Faith Schools
item.description: The controversy over Islamic values imposed in Birmingham schools reveals a contradiction at the heart of Britain’s education policy.
item.dc:creator: By KENAN MALIK

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Beware Libya’s ‘Fair Dictator’
item.description: Backing a strongman like General Hifter may further undermine America’s damaged credibility in the region.
item.dc:creator: By IBRAHIM SHARQIEH
